edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain

Class Drivetrain

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.spa.ftclib.internal.drivetrain.Drivetrain
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    HolonomicFourWheelDrivetrain, TankDrivetrain

    public abstract class Drivetrain
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by Gabriel on 2017-12-27. Basic layout of a robot drivetrain. We use this in our Mecanum, omniwheel, and tank drivetrains, and you can implement it if you create other drivetrains.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      DcMotor[] motors
      All the drive motors included in the drivetrain.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Drivetrain(DcMotor[] motors)
      Makes a new drivetrain with a set of motors.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract double[] calculateMotorPowers() 
      double getVelocity()
      Gets the velocity that the robot has been told to move with.
      void setVelocity(double velocity)
      Sets the velocity at which the robot should move.
      protected void updateMotorPowers()
      Calculates the motor powers and then sends the motor powers to the motors to move the robot.

        public double getVelocity()
        Gets the velocity that the robot has been told to move with.

        The velocity that the robot has been told to move with

      • setVelocity

        public void setVelocity(double velocity)
        Sets the velocity at which the robot should move.
        Parameters:
        velocity - The velocity that you want the robot to move with

      • updateMotorPowers

        protected void updateMotorPowers()
        Calculates the motor powers and then sends the motor powers to the motors to move the robot.

      • calculateMotorPowers

        protected abstract double[] calculateMotorPowers()
        Returns:
        The motorPowers array, which will then be sent to the motors to tell them how fast to move
